Subjective: Headaches x2 months, worsening. Primarily right-sided, sometimes diffuse. Nausea at worst, no vomiting. Glare/visual disturbance, no flashes of light. Pain onset: vacation in Aruba. Social: Student (2nd year), lives alone. No coffee/energy drinks. Occasional alcohol (beer, <2-3/occasion). No smoking/drugs. Family hx: father (migraine), grandfather (cluster headaches). No serious family hx (tumors). No recent stress. ICE: Worried about cause, wants to know if migraine/cluster headache, best treatment.
Objective: BP: 120/80. Pulse: 50 bpm, steady. Neuro exam: Cranial nerves intact. Finger-to-nose normal. Motor strength normal. Romberg negative. Gait: slightly unsteady. Exercise: 4x/week (gym, running, cycling).
Assessment: Headaches, likely migraine. Ruled out: Cluster headache, serious intracranial pathology.
Plan: 1. Explanation of likely migraine diagnosis. 2. Advice: Read information on thuisarts.nl regarding migraines. 3. Meds: Start pain relief (Paracetamol 2 tabs qid OR Ibuprofen) immediately upon symptom onset. 4. Lifestyle: Keep headache diary (print provided) to track triggers/patterns. 5. Follow-up: Return in 4 weeks with diary for review. Return sooner if worsening or new concerns.
